definition: clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: New era brings forward new requirements for local police directors.

sentences.english: The round-visiting village police system is a model of police tasks in the practice of reform of the countryside local police station.

sentences.english: The buildings of police substations were, although small, the most powerful instrument of the power activated under this system.

Mr. Tian angrily warning, but police let the two sides through consultation.

definition: public security bureau (government office similar in function to a police station)
civil police/PRC police/abbr. for 人民警察
to dispatch police to the scene of crime, accident etc
